website_summaries.verdict: A very effective way to keep your handgun safe and still be able to access it quickly.
pros: 3 different ways to enter the safe
Small enough to fit in a night stand drawer
Mountable from the inside to a wall or drawer
cons: Sharp noise when the latch releases, making it hard to open quietly

website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a compact way to keep your pistol out of the wrong hands, this is an effective choice.
pros: The biometric locking system on this pistol case creates a tight control on who can access the gun
3 means of entry make it accessible when needed
Small enough to fit in a drawer
Can store and recognize fingerprints for 2 people
cons: Has a loud click when opening

customer_reviews.title: This safe is too easy to break into
customer_reviews.text: The biometric version of the Quick Access Pistol Safe is nearly identical to the standard model, the only difference being the fingerprint reader. All the design flaws of the standard model remain intact. As a result, the housing for the locking mechanism leaves a gap that can be exploited with a metal shim, and I was able to reach in with a steel cable tie to bump the release. This safe was examined June 9, 2017. To learn about the standard model of the Quick Access Pistol Safe, visit HandgunSafeResearch.com.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Gas Strut Arm Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: I'd strongly advise that you buy a more reliable safe. The gas strut arm in mine, which opens the door, stopped working after a year and a half. The door opens about 2 inches and just stops. When I contacted SentrySafe's customer service, they said I'd need to pay for a new gas strut, which would be $20 + tax (and I assume shipping). It doesn't make sense to me to pay around $30 every year and a half to keep the safe working and hope that it works when you need it. Don't waste your money like I did. Get another safe! PS - I wrote a review on Sentry Safe's website and they removed it. Beware!!!!
customer_reviews.author: zzlibertarian

customer_reviews.title: LID DOESN'T WORK
customer_reviews.text: Completely disappointed with the durability of this product, based on the price I paid for it and other products on the same range, I tried to contact the brand customer support for assistance before I wrote a review on it and had no feedback, its been weeks already. Definitely not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro K

customer_reviews.title: NOT RELIABLE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely dissatisfied with this safe. I have had it for 7 months and the batteries constantly need replacing. There are MANY times it does not recognize my fingerprint at all. I bought the safe to store prescription medication, not a gun. If you want a safe that will work for a gun during a stressful situation such as a home invasion, this is NOT a reliable safe!!! The individual I intended to keep out of the safe has also managed to order a spare key and to take medications. Stay away if you want real security!
customer_reviews.author: Caren L. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes for this, but was proven ...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this, but was proven wrong. I ordered the safe and it would not close and lock. I replaced it, and that safe came to me cracked and I could not set the code as well. Someone else's return authorization was in the 2nd safe I received, meaning it had already been returned to Amazon as defective and then sold to me. Completely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control by manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: The unit looks and felt solid but if I could give this a lower rating than 1 star I would. The first unit I purchased came with the keys and instructions locked inside the safe. Additionally the unit was supposed to be new but the wear on the outside suggested it was not. I returned the unit and the replacement unit I received had a manual with instructions that were not for the specific model I purchased. I could not get the unit set up properly as it was missing the proper setup instructions. I returned this unit as well. I am going with a different brand of safe. Really disappointed with the poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: JDA

customer_reviews.title: Will fail after time & easy to break into
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this safe just over a year ago and safe is SLOW to open and only opens an inch or so. Changed to fresh batteries and have the same result. Looked online to see if anybody else has this issue and everywhere online shows MANY users have the same issue and the company is recommending to constantly purchase replacement gas struts even after owning the safe for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Brody

customer_reviews.title: Gas Strut Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: After 18 months the gas strut stopped working. I access this safe maybe once every 2 weeks, so I'm not wearing it out. I will do research on either replacing the strut or the safe itself. As far as the strut, I'll contact the company, but I'll be suspect of any replacement they offer. Maybe better to find a high quality strut elsewhere. What a shame, an otherwise solid safe. If you are going to have just one mechanical part, design in the best. Only 18 months of occasional use is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Camper Guy

customer_reviews.title: Love this Safe!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Gun Box from indiegogo a few years back and that thing had horrible biometric. This safe is night and day from Gun Box. A little bit on the pricey side, but great quality. I love this safe's responsive, easy to work biometric feature. Plus you can open with a code if all else fails. It is quick and accurate. Biometric has never failed on me. So much more reliable than my previous safe and opening deploys super fast. Love the blue light illumination inside as well. Super spacious. Fits two full size handguns easily with room for extra mags or ammo, cash, and important docs. Would absolutely recommend to anyone looking for a good nightstand safe.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Rossiter

customer_reviews.title: Safe would NOT open upon receiving it
customer_reviews.text: Received it brand new and upon trying to open the safe would NOT open. Used master lock key to open as normal the first time and the locking mechanism must have been broke or something because I tried simply turning the master lock 50 times and the lid just wouldn't open. Returning and buying a Vaultek instead. Very disappointed, was really excited to have gotten it.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Akromis

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: It will not accept my fingerprints, so that part of the box is not functional for me. However, to be fair, I have almost no friction ridges left on my fingers so this was probably predictable. Entering a new code (or pattern) was simple; however, this is not a numbered keypad and there are just four buttons from which to choose. I like the fact that the piston raises the lid instantly upon entering the correct code. I also like the lighted keypad. Although, there may be better lockboxes for less money, generally I'm satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Solidly Built - Quick Access
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a safe that would keep my firearm inaccessible by my children and would also allow my wife and me to quickly arm ourselves in the event of a home break-in. This safe meets those two objectives and exceeded my expectations. You might find stuff on the internet that tries to dissuade you from buying these kinds of safes due to a potential ability to defeat it, but quite frankly, that's difficult to do, and requires some research as well. Lastly, it's pretty solid, so no one is going to hammer this thing open with force. My wife and I are very happy with this purchase - the finger print reader has worked EVERY time without fail.
customer_reviews.author: NAVY04

customer_reviews.title: Lid Fails For Everyone
customer_reviews.text: So I thought I was the only one, but the lid on the safe failed so that when it is unlocked, it only opens an inch or two instead of popping open like it should. This makes it so I have to dig my fingers under the lid and lift to get it to open....not the greatest for a safe that might be used in an emergency. I looked on their website and EVERYONE on there said they had the same issue. Long story short...AVOID THIS SAFE.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Nice and safe!
customer_reviews.text: Had a biometric gun box ver 1 and that last for a while then died all of a sudden and my firearm was almost stuck inside. Was looking around for an afforable safe with alternative ways to get your firearm. Pros: Fast finger scanner Fast open lid Material is thick and doesn't seem cheap 3 ways to open the safe. No cons so far and happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jammer

customer_reviews.title: Great pistol safe
customer_reviews.text: .This is just what I was looking for to secure 2 of my pistols to keep in my nightstand. It holds my 40 Sig Sauer, extra clip and .380 nicely. I also mounted a Motion Sensor light inside I ordered on Amazon and I could not be more pleased. If you do get this I strongly suggest you also buy a motion sensor light...so glad I did.. Not a high level of security from professional burglars (per some reviews) but keeps guns from kids which is why I purchased! If you need a real high level security buy a $1,000.00 fire proof gun safe.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny

customer_reviews.title: Don't count on the Biometric Lock
customer_reviews.text: This safe works great, until the batteries don't. Without warning you are unable to open the safe without a key (which is two to three times a year). The lights work fine but the safe doesn't open. New batteries restore operation but in an emergency you'll still have to use the key when the batteries are dead and there's no way to tell except to try to open it. This is a poor design. Some indication should alarm when the batteries are going out and they should last longer.
customer_reviews.author: SwdstMaker

customer_reviews.title: Consumer Biometric Safes Not Yet Reliable Including This One!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this last year....fingerprint sensor stopped working at 15 months. Out of warranty, so I'm SOL... I have to rely on the keys for access. The whole purpose of the fingerprint sensor is for quick/stable access. Imagine this failing at the worst possible time. I contacted several safe service companies...all of them tell me that to fix the sensor would cost more than the safe itself. Also, most of them tell me that consumer biometric safes are not reliable yet. This safe expert does an amazing job at analyzing the current market [...] He mentions that one of the most reliable (non-biometric) safes can be found here:
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was good for 3-4 years, now doesn't open properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these about 3 years ago and liked them. However, now the lid doesn't pop open on unlocking any more, so you have to use your fingernails or a tool to gently pry/pull the lid open. It's not stuck, it just lies there and there's no handle to pull it up with. Basically, the spring on the gas strut seems to have gotten tired. I think the manufacturer should have used a better quality of spring steel. Sort of a dumb failure mode for what otherwise has been a solid product for me.
customer_reviews.author: entropymd

customer_reviews.title: I want to love this, but isn’t working great for me.
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, my fingerprints are horrible. Anytime I’ve needed them done for background checks, the officer has commented on them lol. With that being said, this safe doesn’t recognize my fingerprints hardly ever :/ it is absolutely not reliable for me to use the fingerprint scanner, especially if I should need to get in quickly. The button press isn’t super sensitive, so make sure you really press down. It opens really swiftly.... once you have the code in! I wanted to love this, but I did not get my money’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Reese

customer_reviews.title: Good quality safe... worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: WOW... very impressed with this safe!! My husband and I wanted to purchase a safe for our handgun. We have two children at home and wanted something reliable and very safe. It came in the mail quickly; it was very easy to program both my husband and I's finger prints into the scanner. Works every time!!! We also programmed a code into the safe. I would highly recommend! A + + +
customer_reviews.author: Mamabb18Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product!
customer_reviews.text: For a quick access, bed dresser safe, this product is horrible! The fingerprint scanner is very low end and will fail almost always in reading your print. Imagine trying to get to your gun and that reader fails to read your print 5 times, now the safe is locked for a few minutes and you have to use the key.....by the time you get your gun out...you would be shot several times by the perpetrator!
customer_reviews.author: Yatzek

customer_reviews.title: Won’t OPEN  upon receiving!
customer_reviews.text: I’m really, really disappointed. It won’t even open with the key for me to insert the batteries for the first time. Sucks. Sending back immediately. Also....this may be one that was previously returned. You can see scratch marks where it looks like someone tried to pry it open. It also came with plastic & foam SHUT in the door itself and this may actually be the culprit in its inability to open as it seems there’s still plastic stuck in the crack. See license.
customer_reviews.author: AllisonRN

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these safes and bought 4 more as a gift to my friends over the years. After about 2 years on all of them has strut stopped working and the lid doesn't open. One can imagine it is a major safety problem. Customer service charges $20 for the strut. Wouldn't buy it again. Auto struts last about 100 000 cycles and these do like 10 or 20? And every other ear you need to to keep it in the working condition?
customer_reviews.author: Roman P.

customer_reviews.title: Bad at first, but after 7 months it’s terrible.
customer_reviews.text: The safe’s locking mechanism works, but The hydraulics that open the door have failed. Never worked that great to begin with but got progressively worse. At first it open enough for me to get my finger in there. Now after seven months it’s practically useless. I have to use a knife to pry the thing open. Do not buy this safe. I would hate for there to be an emergency where I really needed to get in fast.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda G

customer_reviews.title: The Strut is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this a couple years ago (2017). It was great until the gas strut began to not open it completely. I like the biometric access technology. If not for the gas strut issue, it would get 5 stars from me. I contacted the company to see if they would stand behind the product recently, and they were very nice, but basically offered to sell me a new strut. The original one started getting weak pretty quick, maybe I should have contacted them sooner. I would not have bought this if I had known about the strut issue.
customer_reviews.author: Expert

customer_reviews.title: Gas Piston Failure
customer_reviews.text: QAP1BE purchased May 2, 2016 and already the gas piston won't raise the lid. I keep this in a drawer (which makes the automatic raising of lid a requirement) and access the safe about 4 times per year to pull the gun to take to the range. Unacceptable low quality for this unit to fail this quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Paul of Maine

customer_reviews.title: The safe only works for 12 to 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: It is well built for what it is. The electronics are good, but the gas strut wears out in a very short time. How many times would the average owner open this safe in 18 months if only a gun is stored in it for home defense. 25? 50? 100? NOT MANY !!!! Don't buy this safe !!!! I really liked this safe a lot until it stopped opening.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Poor gas piston design! Steer clear
customer_reviews.text: The gas piston failed on this safe a little more than one year after owning it. To Sentry's credit, they mailed me another one for free. However the replacement one had a cracked part that was integral to attachment. So I'd give this thing a giant FAIL for poor design and poor quality of parts.
customer_reviews.author: J Dingo

customer_reviews.title: Looks STRONG,  THOUGH FINGER PRINT Readers KEEPS STOPS Working! Frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: Looks STRONG, THOUGH FINGER PRINT Readers KEEPS STOPS Working! Frustrating! Reset it, sometimes works for short periods, sometimes REFUSES to reset, THOUGH you should NOT have to in a month New batterires, and the manual code works fine, but the BIO part does NOT work well. WHen it does, it somehow loses its memory or SOMETHING that causes the Finger Print to NOT work! HATE to DEPEND on THAT, so finally went to the 6 digit code, meaning I OVERPAID for the BIO FEAUTURE.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality control!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these safes, one from Amazon and one from a big box store. BOTH safes were defective out of the box. The first safe could not be opened - at all. Not even with the key. The second safe would only open manually with the key. The unlocking mechanism for the keypad and the biometric sensor would not work. Can you imagine needing to get into this safe to save you and your family's life, only to find it would not open? No way! I'll be finding another brand. Once is a fluke. Twice is pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: hiflyer

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to secure my heat for home defense in a way that is easily accessible should I ever need to lay down some busters...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to secure my heat for home defense in a way that is easily accessible should I ever need to lay down some busters. The fingerprint sensor and code buttons work well. I mounted a small motion sensing LED so I can see the inside at night, and it also creates a dramatic effect when the lid opens with a 'woosh' in the pitch black of night. A smoke machine, strobe light and a tiny PA system that blared "I Ain't Goin Out Like That" by Cypress Hill would be pretty sick too but the A/V equipment doesn't come small enough to fit inside. 5 stars for safety and convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Gas shock wears out after a couple years
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for 3 years with low use and the gas strut no longer lifts the lid. You have to kind of wedge your finger under the lip and lift it up. In a high-stakes situation, I don’t want to have to fiddle with the lid to get it to open. Disappointed for the price that this component failed.
customer_reviews.author: nonkn4mer

customer_reviews.title: Best nightstand safe I could find.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good reliable safe. The fingerprint scanner is the best part so far. Work for me every time and opens quickly with only minimal noise. Whenever a friend comes over for the first month I had them try the scanner. 20+ people no one else could open it. I do wish the push buttons had more feedback, they feel real soft and sometime I’m unsure if I pressed it down all the way. Besides that I’m glad I picked this safe.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly after a few programming changes
customer_reviews.text: So initially when I first received it I went straight to the biometrics input. Did not take long to notice that it did not accept the first swipe after tapping it from sleep. In some cases it would fail multiple times. So I went ahead with programming a new code as well as added two fingerprints and immediately it accepted the fingerprint in the first swipe after tapping it from sleep. Not sure if there is a glitch but inserting two prints and a code fixed the issue with the biometrics. So far so good and hope it stays that way.
customer_reviews.author: Saint Seiya

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!
customer_reviews.text: It simply does not work. As many users have called out, the electronics are poor quality, I could not program it. It doesn't open even with the factory code, it only works with keys which is not why I bought it. Amazon should remove this product from it's selection right away, it is so frustrating for customers!
customer_reviews.author: santiagolv

customer_reviews.title: Fingerprint OR keypad, not both
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Fingerprint reader is accurate but you need to swipe slow. Only issue is that you can select the fingerprint reader OR the keypad, can't have both. Key always works. Briefly tried to get the keypad to work but it didn't... Could be my impatience to be honest. Holds my full size and compact and seems secure. Quiet and quick to open with fingerprint. Would recommend for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bronx

customer_reviews.title: Was safe until.....
customer_reviews.text: This review is more of a what the hell are you thinking to another reviewer that we will not be naming. Did you know how to break into before you opened it? Thanks to your instructional videos you have now put every owner of this safe children in danger. It's was a perfectly fine safe until you showed everyone how to break into it. Again, could you break into before opening it and inspecting the locking mechanism. Well done sir. If my kids use a cable tie to break into my safe I'll blame you.
customer_reviews.author: David S Showalter

customer_reviews.title: Great fingerprint reader, not so great hydraulic opening arm.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this safe for a few years now and really enjoyed it. The fingerprint reader works very well, only a few situations where I had to swipe my finger a second time to open. As the years have gone by the hydraulic opening arm has become less and less strong and doesn’t pop open like it used to, requiring me to open it fully. I would recommend this as a good starter safe. It’s better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: aliG

customer_reviews.title: As a basic storage container it's fine. Only issue is the print reader
customer_reviews.text: The fingerprint function didn't work reliably. Maybe once out of 15 tries it would recognise my print. It doesn't beep and opens more quietly than my other pistol safe. In any emergency I will have to remember the code. Not what I wanted. As a basic storage container it's fine. Only issue is the print reader.... but obviously that is critical.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Bag
customer_reviews.text: It does it's job, and thank goodness the combination buttons and key access work because the fingerprint reader is as bad as it gets. It's just horrible. Program in a button combo and use that instead. It's not ideal because it takes longer to open than a reliable fingerprint reader would take, but it's still a decent overall value. I recommend it, but do not buy it for the fingerprint option.
customer_reviews.author: nullus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for me
customer_reviews.text: I want to be sure that my handguns are secured. I looked at many biometric models and settled on this one. Ultimately, I ended up buying three. One for the bedroom, back door and my car. I took a bike lock and secured it to the seat post in the floorboard of the passenger side. That way if my vehicle ever got broken into, they wouldn't be able to find it in the console and swipe it. I routinely walk by and swipe my thumb over the biometric lock and it opens every time. The batteries are a year old and are by all accounts doing good. Very pleased with the product
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Solid, quality safe for decent price.
customer_reviews.text: Relatively simple to set up. Registered my fingerprint after about 3 test swipes, took about a dozen for my spouse's to register. Not silent opening, but not very loud either. Test it every couple weeks and so far batteries are holding up fine. Sturdy construction and very good quality. Plenty of room for a full size pistol and extra mag. I would say that two compact handguns would fit just fine. Like having the combination unlock in addition to the biometric - would be nice if it stored more than two prints. My son got a model of another brand that cost him about 3 times as much and it doesn't work as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great littlr safe, reader can be finicky at times but works great 99% of the time.
customer_reviews.text: Great little safe, not as slim as expected but that's my fault as the dimensions are listed. Only reason i didn't give 5 stars is that the finger print reader can be finicky at times which concerns me slightly if need to access in a hurry. That said I am confident it will only open for me so it secures my home and restricts young ones access indefinitely. Have had multiple people try the reader and it only opens for me as intended. Good product and feels sturdy, almost to heavy and thick for end table drawer though, make sure you measure and test ur drawer if that's where you intend for it to go.
customer_reviews.author: Bloto

customer_reviews.title: Strut stops working, safe won’t open.
customer_reviews.text: Not great. The fingerprint reader works only sometimes, which means it works no times. If you can’t rely on it when you need it, it’s useless. I end up just using the code to open it. Here is the worst part though - the gas strut which opens the same no longer works, so the safe doesn’t even open! Imagine that! You go to open the safe in a time of need, and it unlocks, but doesn’t open enough for you to get the gun out! Nothing can be worse than that. Yes, you can replace the strut, and I will, but that’s not the point. If it fails when you need it most, it’s useless.
customer_reviews.author: Magna Veritas

customer_reviews.title: Failed after only 4 years, and very minor use.
customer_reviews.text: I have ownership of the safe for the last four years. It’s been sitting in my master bedroom the entire time, probably opened close to 100 times throughout its lifetime. Lately the shock strut that raises the lid has failed to work. As seen in the video. It’s kind of useless if you can’t get to your firearm. Overall I like that it’s nice and heavy, steel is thick. Wish it lasted me longer. I guess time to shop for some other brand.
customer_reviews.author: V. Stepchin

customer_reviews.title: it's the perfect single gun safe
customer_reviews.text: This is my first gun safe and I've had it for a few months now. Very happy with its design and functionality. Note, this is a top-access safe, so make sure you have enough clearance above the safe. Some nice features: Quick and quiet access. Easy to program. Triple redundancy; biometric, 4-button combination keypad, tubular key-lock. Slim profile. Easy to install. The only sight negative so far is the biometric finger scanner. It seems the proper scanning range for finger placement is about 10 degrees either side of dead center. Not a big deal, but if you're accessing the safe from the side, the 4-button keypad might be faster.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!!!
customer_reviews.text: My Sig Sauer P365, gun holster, and magazine holster fit perfectly in the safe. The set up was easy and required 4AA batteries. I love the fingerprint feature. Makes it easy to access so you’re not fumbling around looking for a key. Even with my long nails (as seen in the video) I can still open the safe.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty impressed by the finger print scanner on this. I works every time. I did both of my first fingers and it has yet to fail after about 100 tries. I also input a 6 digit code in case the fingerprint scanner fails. The box seems heavy duty and shock is solid that opens the top. Fairly easy to program and mount. All around I like it. It fit nicely in my top drawer of my night stand (bolted in). I do wish I had a Plug in option to keep it charged all the time but It does warn you when batteries are getting low which is good!
customer_reviews.author: K Bratch

customer_reviews.title: Great safe at a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this safe! I purchased one from Costco and I keep my EDC pistol in it in my truck. I hate the idea of someone breaking into my truck and getting a weapon. I love this thing so much I checked pricing on Amazon and it's actually cheaper now than at Costco...doesn't happen often. Anyway, the safe is super simple to set up; the instructions are clear. It's also ridiculously easy to access. Fingerprint, code or key. You're not going to get locked out. If you're a responsible gun owner then you really should keep your weapons in a good, quick-access safe. This is it!
customer_reviews.author: BLeadbetter

customer_reviews.title: The bio-metric reader is reliable but slower than using the ...
customer_reviews.text: The bio-metric reader is reliable but slower than using the buttons. Buttons are numbered 1 through 4, so I mentally assigned 5,6,7,8 to the same 4 buttons and 9,0 to the first 2. Now I can program it for any positive integer, up to 6 digits. And yes, it works for both the finger print reader and the button programs. I don't see how it could be made quieter without giving up the spring loaded action. The hinge pins are inside so there is no worry about getting in by removing the hinge. The battery compartment is difficult to access without using a flash light. I use it for my Sig P320 RX 9mm and an extra magazine.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence G Meares

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.text: After 18 months, the door only open less than half-way, then stuck. We have to lift it open again to access the pistol. Not a solid product. We contacted the customer service, was told the most of the doors on this model only last 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Biometric lock defective
customer_reviews.text: The key and 4-button key pad worked fine, but the biometric lock only worked about 10% of the time. I tried repeatedly programming and re programming it. I tried using different fingers, fingers moist or dry, differing amounts of finger pressure, different speeds of pulling my finger across the finger print reader, but the result was always the same. It failed to open about 90% of the times I tried. I'm returning it after giving up with two day's worth of trying.
customer_reviews.author: grell6954

customer_reviews.title: Not much use if it won’t open
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these safes. After taking the first one out of the box, it opened one time with the key. I closed it and was never able to reopen it with the key or any other method. I will not put the safety of my family in the hands of a defective product. This is obviously a known issue, as there is a small troubleshooting section in the user guide that covers the safe not opening at all, even with override physical key. This blows my mind that they would still sell these safes without fixing this critical flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Jhugh1214

customer_reviews.title: Very satisified.. Louder than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Works just as advertised. Only wish there was a lock down cable with it for travel. Plenty of room for my 9mm a handheld flashlite and 1 clip. It is a bit noisy however. We were very surprised at the loud click and whoosh it makes as it flings open, when it's advertised as silent. There is no inside lite but our instructor said not to get one as it would give away your location faster in the dark. But overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: not reliable at all
customer_reviews.text: the system of safe working so unstable..i just received today. during i resetting new code, the system was dead...(new betteries). later, it worked again..finally i finished reset..but when i tried it 10 mins later. it was dead again. not reliable at all...
customer_reviews.author: qingyuzhao

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Worst gun safe ever! Biometrics work only when they want to. Sometimes it will stay set a week, sometimes a month or some times only a few days. If you need to open this gun safe in the middle of the night to protect your family, you're all DEAD!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: No customer service
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes, the fingerprint sensor does not work immediately. I tried to contact the seller; however, there is NO option to contact the seller at all. Maybe because the item was sold by Amazon LLC. I am very disappointed. It is very critical to have the safe open immediately through the fingerprint. In a bad scenario, every second could save a life!
customer_reviews.author: Mohamad M.

customer_reviews.title: Strut fails when you need it most, look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.text: Rarely used, except for emergencies... what these reviews don't tell you is that this product has a huge issue with the strut failing even with infrequent usage. Be careful because when you need it most, it just WON'T OPEN! Don't take my word for it, check YouTube, everyone recommends changing the strut to a more reliable product - personally, I would pay more to start with higher quality and this is not it. Good luck, be safe!
customer_reviews.author: kW

customer_reviews.title: All that time wasted and I'm sure I'll be stuck with a shipping ...
customer_reviews.text: I literally just got this in and its broken! Sending back ASAP! I called customer support to tell them what was wrong and the lady said she hates this model!! She always has people calling about this safe and she told me to send it back and don't get the same safe. I swear I can't make this up. I couldn't believe it! All that time wasted and I'm sure I'll be stuck with a shipping fee to return it. Uncool. If it works for you right now great! But don't let this be your go to if in case of an emergency! Please listen and for your own safety make sure you have something reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, fingerprint reader has some issues.
customer_reviews.text: This safe is a little small and may have trouble fitting some larger full-size items. Additionally, there is no light inside so in the dark you are left to feel around (not necessarily safe in a tense situation). While acceptable, the fingerprint reader is sometimes finicky and is not something I would feel comfortable using successfully in the dead of night. The small profile is nice, but it makes it hard to fit a finger onto the reader when placed in a drawer. I would recommend you pick up the larger version without the fingerprint reader that has interior illumination so you can see what you are doing and stay safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff P.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty design
customer_reviews.text: The device won't open all the way once the passcode is activated and I had to complete the action manually. I called the manufacturer to explain my issue and they told me that I can only use Duracell or Energizer batteries with an expiration date of no later than 2026 in order to ensure that I have enough power to properly activate the device. It was all I could do to contain my laughter over the phone. I'm returning the safe and will never buy from SentrySafe again!
customer_reviews.author: James Pixler

customer_reviews.title: Great lock box
customer_reviews.text: I have had this box for several months now. This is what I use to keep my pistol locked in my night stand. I have had no problems with batteries running out like I read some people mention. This is a great little box. I gave it 4 out of 5 because it could be a little bigger. It holds my full size Springfield XD, but doesn't really have room for much more than a spare magazine and maybe a small flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: SleepsInNE

customer_reviews.title: Reliable fingerprint reader, fairly quick deployment
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic safe to keep your firearm safe and away from your child but accessible enough to protect yourself. The fingerprint reader is pretty quick, and it hasn’t had a misread yet. The quick-touch buttons are nice to have as well. Have only had it for a week so I can’t say much about battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Batura

customer_reviews.title: Safe door doesn’t open all the way
customer_reviews.text: After entering the correct passcode or finger swipe the safe door does not open all the way. I have to use either my finger or something else to pry open the safe. Not ideal when needing to access the safe in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great little sage with awesome features.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first gun safe and I am really happy with it. It is the perfect size for one firearm the extra clip and some ammo. I like that you can use biometrics. Code or a key to open it. The other feature I like is that you can screw it in to the bottom of the drawer so it can’t be carried away.
customer_reviews.author: Deb G.

customer_reviews.title: Fingerprint fail
customer_reviews.text: Print reader sunk too far into plastic to make reliable contact with finger. After a dozen attempts to program a print, I found that I had to press down hard for it to work, the safe seems good and the combo buttons work good, but the finger print reader is useless, I will be returning and order the cheaper one without reader.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE MOST RELIABLE
customer_reviews.text: Gas strut lasts abt 6 months and the fingerprint scanner and code work great for a month or two and then wont work for a while and then start working again. the batteries only last abt 12 months then the light blinks red. Just keep your key handy. You will need it!!
customer_reviews.author: Terry T.

customer_reviews.title: Read Instructions Carefully
customer_reviews.text: All works as expected, but getting two different fingerprints stored takes careful attention to the directions. If you careful, you just keep over-writing the 1st print. There is an extra press of the hidden button (in the battery compartment) to store the 2nd print.
customer_reviews.author: S. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up!  I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to keep at my bedside and at work for silent and quick entry. This item was super easy to set up and both my husband and I were able to program two fingerprints at different times without an issue. Touching the fingerprint sensor wakes it up then I can slide my finger again and it instantly opens. For those who have had problems, reading and following the simple instructions is a piece of cake. I am super happy so far!!! I will likely buy a second. Perfect choice for me!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie D.

customer_reviews.title: he can operate it just fine despite his memory issues with the fingerprint scanner
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a person with a brain injury to keep their wallet safe in the group home. He loves it, he can operate it just fine despite his memory issues with the fingerprint scanner. Battery seems to last a long time, and if anyone was going to have trouble with technology, it's someone with a traumatic brain injury! Should be great for any use, pistol or otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy enough, but Couldn't get it to work
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy enough, but Couldn't get it to work, neither bio-metric nor combination, only way to open it was with the key.
customer_reviews.author: Pommity

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Handgun Safe
customer_reviews.text: Solid and easy to use. It's not as quiet as I expected from the advertisements, there are metallic noises when opened, but not so loud that it's a distraction or sure give away. It easily holds my 9mm Beretta with 2 extra 10 round clips so roomy enough. There are only 4 buttons for the digital access code but it does allow up to six digits and only having 4 may be better for quick access at night. All-in-all a very nice product which I think very nicely balances quick access and safety.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie521

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: This is SUPER heavy and very easy to program and use. The directions are easy to follow and it easily fits 1 handgun. The lid gently opens when you put in the code or use your fingerprint. Can get into it in just a few seconds. Small enough to fit on a bedside table, comes with hardware to attach, but we didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Balsitis

customer_reviews.title: Fast opening gun safe
customer_reviews.text: I'm completely satisfied with this safe. It's a good size for a single handgun, a spare magazine,and maybe a knife, flashlight,or whatever other defensive item you may want to have secured but quickly at hand. Programming fingerprints was exactly as described in the instructions. The safe also opens with a 4-6 number code of your choosing or a key. My favorite part is that it opens reliably and quickly when you need it to. I may just buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The code system is nice allowing you to choose a 4-6 digit code
customer_reviews.text: Do your part and keep your guns out of reach of children. This safe will do the trick. It comes with two keys which I have separated and keep hidden. The code system is nice allowing you to choose a 4-6 digit code. The material is thick and feels solid, the unit heavy. I am very pleased with it and have recommended it to others to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Safe
customer_reviews.text: I have the first baby on the way, so I decided to up the security on my pistol. this is a great little safe that fits my MP9 Shield and 2 clips with some room to spare. I wish the single weapon safe was a little bigger, so I could store a small box of home defense rounds in it, but just the clips is fine. The finger print reader is pretty quick, and I've never had a bad read. The code is also a quick option to open the safe. All together, I'm very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Landress

customer_reviews.title: Almost 2 years later - no issues
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would write a review for the average "gun owner for protection" user on this safe. Almost 2 years later (purchased in December 2018), it still works without any issues. We don't open several times a week but every once and a while and as needed for travel or target practice. Same set of batteries and works the first time every time. No issues on opening struts either. We did forget our button code, but that's to be expected at my age. :-) Going to change the batteries today as a maintenance item. Be blessed!
customer_reviews.author: Bill C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t open all the way after two years
customer_reviews.text: Fingerprint reader has always been iffy and now it doesn’t pop open all the way after two years of extremely light use (I may have opened it ten times?). Absolutely no confidence I’d be able to open this in the middle of the night when it mattered.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Nice entry features
customer_reviews.text: Nice entry features. Well built and darn heavy. Bolted mine to inside of bedroom lamp table. My lamp table is very stout and drawer removal has also been secured.....no longer removable without using considerable time and effort. Used a cabinet bumper pad to help keep the lid from being too noisy when opening. Wish the LED lights were not as bright. Might be a fix for that, and will have to do some homework soon. The state I live in has approved this storage device.........check your states requirements for approved handgun storage devices. Yep, it's true so be responsible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazons First Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Works, I think...  expensive for what it is
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had two of these. The first one the gas strut went out after a few months and didn’t pop open on its own. Also a couple of times i I've found it open in the drawer. Can’t tell if it opened on its own or ???. I think the safe has some quality issues. The second unit I ordered on amazon was clearly used and returned and was missing keys and I immediately returned it.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This gun safe works just as described. I know others have mentioned that the finger print feature doesn't always work, but I have had it about 6 months now and have opened it many times just to make sure the batter is still working. It opens on point every time.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Waste You’re $$$
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. The safe will break and the seller will leave you hanging as will the manufacturer. Safe lasted about a year with very little use.
customer_reviews.author: colin snodgrass

customer_reviews.title: Fingerprint recorder's kind of weird but ok
customer_reviews.text: The finger print instruction's kind of weird, erasing and adding can be kind of ambiguous, so in the end I only recorded my right hand on there which is still okay. Key unlock is perfect Code unlock is also perfect. Fits Glock 19 gen 3 with streamlight 1xmagpul 27 round mag 2x oem 10 round mag no problem.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great!! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Totally serves it's purpose. Keeps everyone but myself and my husband out. It is roomier than I expected. I keep my pistol, 2 boxes of ammo, and our passports- with room to spare. FYI: there are videos on YouTube that demonstrate how to get into this particular safe with a factory default code. So everyone should absolutely set up their own code to disable the factory settings!!!
customer_reviews.author: LostAngel666

customer_reviews.title: A little bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: No matter how many times I try it, the safe only accepts one finger print. I followed the instructions but as soon as a second finger print is entered, it will overwrite the first one. Other than this problem, I liked the size, sturdiness, and all others.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: Its a convenient safe to keep a handgun in. Big enough for one handgun with a few magazines. I like that it has a fingerprint open option to make it quick. The biggest issue i have with mine is that the door gets stuck. The lock unlocks but the door does not spring up. I have to open the door manually. Could create an issue in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: WORKS FOR ABOUT A YEAR
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these. The first stopped working after a year. The second lasted about 14 months. When I called Sentry, they told me it was a faulty wiring issue and then charged me to send me a new part that did not work. It is pretty scary to think that these are USELESS in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I like that this safe feels so solid. There are multiple ways to open it... key, fingerprint and passcode. It holds my p365 and a spare mag, as well as my ppq and a spare mag. Pops right open, isn’t loud and fancy, and it keeps my firearms easy to reach for me and safely out of reach of intruders or my children.
customer_reviews.author: Chad G

customer_reviews.title: Best Bedside Pistol Safe
customer_reviews.text: This safe is awesome. It locks 3 ways - fingerprint, key, and/or number pad. You can change what codes it accepts, for example, only having it open with a fingerprint. It is really heavy and rugged. We keep it on our night stands so at night with just one swipe we can have it open while we sleep. During the day just push it closed and won't have to worry about kids having access.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Great slim safe to hide your valuables, or gun.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great safe! I don't use it to store guns as they don't allow them in NYC. But, it is great for small items like expensive watches or emergency cash. It is slim and fits in most places; cupboard space, drawers, etc. It is easily screwed down. I would not recommend you place this somewhere where they can just walk away with it. The fingerprint sensor works without any issues and opens quickly. NOTE: You can only configure it with 2 fingerprints, so the third person will need to know the button sequence to open it.
customer_reviews.author: LeonardH

customer_reviews.title: Safe stopped working. No response from Sentry. Do Not buy from them.
customer_reviews.text: Biometric function stopped working after a few weeks. Sentry customer care does not answer the phone. In fact when I first tried to call all I got was a fast busy signal...I tried several times over a few hours. Finally the next day they answered my call, or rather I was sent to terminal on hold for 30 minutes until I finally gave up. No answer to my emails either. I will be returning this safe. Do NOT buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: ... a full size Glock 22 and spare magazine just fine. I attached one of these inside the lid ...
customer_reviews.text: Holds a full size Glock 22 and spare magazine just fine. I attached one of these inside the lid () and now anytime I open up the safe, the LED light comes on and illuminates the contents of the safe. Fingerprint reader on it works great and I love that it has a backup code you can program in. While the fingerprint scanner is not going to work 100% of the time, that backup code will.
customer_reviews.author: Blake B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice safe but not all types of .45 pistols will fit!
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this safe a 5 but the reason I didn't is because my .45 pistol (an FNX Tactical) barely fits so I have to place the gun in the safe sideways and it's very snug which is not really what I like. I want to be able to grab the gun quickly and without rubbing the case. Other than that, I like the safe and all features work properly and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Anne-Marie Stowe

customer_reviews.title: SentrySafe QAP1BE Gun Safe
customer_reviews.text: Just set this up last night and it was very easy to configure both the key pad and touch pad. I set up the touch pad for both myself and my wife and it works great for both of us. I was able to get my 9mm double stack compact carry and my wife's 380. Both fit with holster. Safe opens silently, quickly and easily. Love that the lid pops open with a silent gas strut lift.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great small gun safe
customer_reviews.text: Great gun safe. Heavy duty quality. 3 ways to access. Key lock. Key pad. And biometric finger scanner. Plenty of room for 2 compact pistols or revolvers or 1 full size gun with plenty of room for magazines or cash passports etc. I highly recommend. With Amazon Prime I had next day delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Ixo Valdes

customer_reviews.title: Gas Strut does not have a long life span
customer_reviews.text: I concur with other users, the gas strut, after about a year, completely stopped working. The safe will not open on its own. You would think that a gas strut would last 4-5 years, or am I not being reasonable. I called the company, they said they would send me a free one ... never received. :(
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: This works great, but if you are freaking out you might ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great, but if you are freaking out you might take a few deep breaths before you try to implement it!! Plan with fingerprint, code, and key....and PRACTICE. Oh, and let your college students know that they need to let you know that they are coming home rather than surprising you on a Friday night! JUST FYI! PRACTICE and PERFECT!
customer_reviews.author: JMorgs

customer_reviews.title: Received wrong item unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: The quality looked fantastic, unfortunately the one I received did not have a fingerprint reader. I returned it and bought something locally.
customer_reviews.author: BDR

customer_reviews.title: Unlocks but doesn't open
customer_reviews.text: My problem with this safe is how it works and the door. For both biometric access and keypad, fist you need to wake the device, then use your finger for biometric or input pass code. even if I am able to input pass code it unlocks the door but door doesn't open. I have to push the door and close and input code again. This is not acceptable. Check for other safes.
customer_reviews.author: ibrahim Adiyaman

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking to get one of these for a while, I just was not sure on what brand to get. I am very happy with this safe. It is great, very heavy and solid built, especially for the price. Finger print scanner works okay. Hydronic shock could be a little better. Fits my g17 good. I would be confident on it opening when needed
customer_reviews.author: Ben Miller

product_meta.title: SentrySafe QAP1BE Gun Safe with Biometric Lock, 1 Capacity
product_meta.description: Size:1 Gun CapacityThe SentrySafe QAP1BE Gun Safe with Biometric Lock is equipped with a biometric fingerprint scanner to protect your firearms from unauthorized access. This biometric gun safe also offers back-up entry with a silent digital keypad and override key to provide advanced protection for your home defense needs. Designed with a compression gas strut for single handed access to allow for fast and quiet access to your handgun when you need it most.
feature_bullets: Biometric gun safe provides secure storage for one standard handgun; pistol safe with fingerprint scanner for advanced protection
Pistol safe features a gas strut to instantly and quietly open safe door for single-handed access to your handgun; ideal for use as a bedside gun safe. Capacity - 0.08 cubic feet
Handgun safe is constructed with solid steel and a pry resistant door for strength and handgun security; manual keypad and override key for back up entry; California DOJ certified gun safe
Exterior: 12.1 in. W x 9.9 in. D. x 3.2 in. H; Interior 9.7 in. W x 6.7 in. D x 2.2 in. H; weighs 12 pounds; four AA batteries required (not included)

For optimal performance, SentrySafe recommends the use of four high-quality, name branded, alkaline AA batteries with an expiration date of 8-10 years from the current year. Generic and rechargeable batteries often do not have the lifespan needed to support long term usage

specifications.Manufacturer: MASTER LOCK COMPANY LLC / SENTRY SAFE
specifications.Included Components: Sentrysafe Quick-Access Biometric Pistol Safe, Override Key, Owner's Manual
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,318 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
